body:
> That is not the root cause. Since you are here, please show me where's the sharding-sphere-4.x-RC3-plugin.jar.

`skywalking/skywalking-agent/plugins/`

> The new version of plugin built after the test finish. Sheng said the jar will be separately built in test phase that I didn't find.

Sorry, I don't see what you mean.
@dmsolr Yes. I read those too, that is why I am confused about the @tuohai666 's doubts.

@wu-sheng sharding-sphere-4.x-RC3-plugin.jar happened after the test finish. To make the test success, the sharding-sphere-4.x-RC3-plugin.jar need to be packaged before test. How PluginsTest package plugins? I didn't find it in log.

> @wu-sheng sharding-sphere-4.x-RC3-plugin.jar happened after the test finish. To make the test success, the sharding-sphere-4.x-RC3-plugin.jar need to be packaged before test. How PluginsTest package plugins? I didn't find it in log.

@tuohai666 every plugin test compiles and builds the plugin, check https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/6af14a36bcaa94741cd1a2709ba3193d5f764b9c/.github/workflows/plugins-test.yaml#L43 so don’t worry about the plugin package, it must exist absolutely, otherwise all plugin should fail from time to time

> @wu-sheng sharding-sphere-4.x-RC3-plugin.jar happened after the test finish. To make the test success, the sharding-sphere-4.x-RC3-plugin.jar need to be packaged before test. How PluginsTest package plugins? I didn't find it in log.

I think you have a mistake. The first, we find it in the log, but it is a bit difficult because of too long.
And I don't think the test-framework has the issue which you said.
And then, the log shows so clearly, the plugin has worked. We can it is generated `actualData.yml` which means the plugin working.

@tuohai666 The full qualified class names of the new plugin instrumentation classes (and interceptors) are exactly the same as the old ones, I’m not sure whether it’s related to this issue and whether it’s stably reproducible in local machine(at least I can’t reproduce), but it definitely matters in some degree, I don’t think JVM can load two same classes using the same class loader (AgentClassloader), I suspect that some of them are “hidden” by the old ones, could you recheck?
@kezhenxu94 Thanks for your patience. I'll think about that.
@kezhenxu94 At the same time, can you do me a favor to test my repo in your local? I can pass the test in my local, now it's not enough.

Typo, I mean I can... 
I found something, let me have a test first.

> I suspect that some of them are “hidden” by the old ones, could you recheck?

@tuohai666 I just rechecked the codes, the classes with same names are mostly identical, so this is not the cause, but maybe we need to refactor the ShardingSphere plugins to extract some codes to be reused, maybe another PR after this gets merged. WDYT @wu-sheng

@kezhenxu94 Yes, you are right, that will be better.

I checked my codes again and the test suceed again in local. Can you help to test in my repo? Maybe we can find something.

> @kezhenxu94 Yes, you are right, that will be better.
> 
> I checked my codes again and the test suceed again in local. Can you help to test in my repo? Maybe we can find something.

I've just run it locally, and it passed too

Two things, 1. Maybe relate to thread, different JVM has different thread model. 2. JDBC connection. It may close before the next execution.

As far as I known, ss includes its own thread pool. So, be careful about this.

Agree with you , @wu-sheng 

I run it on centos7. It is failed. And Github action runs on Ubuntu-18. I think both of you run on macOS.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29735230/71569545-c996ec00-2b0a-11ea-8bcf-7458885a14f3.png)
@dmsolr Thanks for your help. I will firstly change to openjdk and then find a Linux machine to find out the root cause.

There are plenty of similar questions, you should search. And the documentation indicates you need to time and timezone right.
Any further discussion?
@Fine0830 Is there a tech to mock the browser, making the client-js working and tracing?

> There are plenty of similar questions, you should search. And the documentation indicates you need to time and timezone right.

建议将做法放到这里https://github.com/apache/skywalking-docker/ 的docker启动参数中，会减少很多这样的issue。
This is the global used project. We can't set that.
In 6.6.0 release, the UI will fetch the TZ automatically. As you are using 6.4, it is not there.

> In 6.6.0 release, the UI will fetch the TZ automatically. As you are using 6.4, it is not there.

it sounds great.

Another similar but not exactly the same problem:

> ...
[INFO] Module build failed (from ./node_modules/mini-css-extract-plugin/dist/loader.js):
[INFO] ModuleBuildError: Module build failed (from ./node_modules/sass-loader/dist/cjs.js):
[INFO] Error: Missing binding /path/to/skywalking/skywalking-ui/node_modules/node-sass/vendor/linux-x64-57/binding.node
[INFO] Node Sass could not find a binding for your current environment: Linux 64-bit with Node.js 8.x
[INFO] 
[INFO] Found bindings for the following environments:
[INFO]   - Linux 64-bit with Node.js 13.x
[INFO] 
[INFO] This usually happens because your environment has changed since running `npm install`.
[INFO] Run `npm rebuild node-sass` to download the binding for your current environment.
[INFO]     at module.exports (/path/to/skywalking/skywalking-ui/node_modules/node-sass/lib/binding.js:15:13)
...


The "Error: Missing binding" line indicate that node-sass didn't access to the binding file. Downloading the file manually ( from [here](https://github.com/sass/node-sass/releases), select the correct file and don't forget change the name of file ) solve the problem.

CI keeps failure. Please recheck.
Why remove ref? I am confused about your changes
Does this PR support we can using anntation write our agent plugins ?

> Does this PR support we can using anntation write our agent plugins ?

In the test, it can't, because they are not in the release :) So they are copied into the test project too.

> > Does this PR support we can using anntation write our agent plugins ?
> 
> In the test, it can't, because they are not in the release :) So they are copied into the test project too.

Great feature!

> Does this PR support we can using anntation write our agent plugins ?

Do you mean using `@Tag` in the agent plugin methods? No you can't, classes of agent plugins are ignored:

https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/1ee14fbbc8251a1faa5f3851d4f7d92f9ec1ab15/apm-sniffer/apm-agent/src/main/java/org/apache/skywalking/apm/agent/SkyWalkingAgent.java#L90-L98

so although you can annotate the plugin method with `@Tag`, it takes no effect

> > Does this PR support we can using anntation write our agent plugins ?
> 
> Do you mean using `@Tag` in the agent plugin methods? No you can't, classes of agent plugins are ignored:
> 
> https://github.com/apache/skywalking/blob/1ee14fbbc8251a1faa5f3851d4f7d92f9ec1ab15/apm-sniffer/apm-agent/src/main/java/org/apache/skywalking/apm/agent/SkyWalkingAgent.java#L90-L98
> 
> so although you can annotate the plugin method with `@Tag`, it takes no effect

Yes, you got what i thought.  I think it's meaningful & If we do, make our developer write plugins  simplfy. @kezhenxu94

> Yes, you got what i thought. I think it's meaningful & If we do, make our developer write plugins simplfy. @kezhenxu94

It supports LocalSpan only now! :)
Making no-local span is more about exact and inject ContextCarrier :) Even we add that, I think it will be closer to OpenTracing APIs, even it is not widely used.

> > Yes, you got what i thought. I think it's meaningful & If we do, make our developer write plugins simplfy. @kezhenxu94
> 
> It supports LocalSpan only now! :)

@dmsolr nope, it supports any kinds of span (it is not related to specific kind of span), except for those annotated by `RequestMapping` and similar annotations that are intercepted by other agent plugins
I got it. We work with Spring-Annotations plugins.

I have reproduced this problem in CentOS 7.6.

Exception or HTTP response code. Then calculate the success rate.

It is harmless for the target application, yes. But this could make plugin failure if the target class is the instrumentation target. :) 

I am OK to change the log level to debug.

closed by #4119
closed by https://github.com/apache/skywalking-cli/pull/26

I have request @ascrutae to update the demo env. After that, you could use this `type` field in service register, https://github.com/apache/skywalking-data-collect-protocol/blob/master/register/Register.proto#L56

And, at the same time, suggest API change from  
```
new ClientMonitor()
.serviceName("svr-browser")
.instanceName("svr-browser-v1") // Optional, if empty, use the same name as service to register
```
to
```
new ClientMonitor()
.browserSvrName("svr-browser") // Still as service name, but indicate it is a browser app.
.version("svr-browser-v1") // Optional, if empty, use `default` as version number. For backend interface, still use this as instance name, but this name should be consistent with the further rocketbot UI browser monitoring page.
```
@kezhenxu94 @innerpeacez Please update the year of CLI and k8s subprojects too.

> Why change Tomcat plugin rather than changing SpringMVC plugin? It should be more adaptive?

Is it possible to assume that all http services are based on SpringMVC? Armeria is an apparent exception, and that's why we have Tomcat plugin and Spring MVC plugin now
I am not sure whether Tomcat plugin will face the parameter encoding issue.

> I am not sure whether Tomcat plugin will face the parameter encoding issue.

Yes sadly, I've suffered from that, and that's why the codes to get parameter map in Tomcat plugin is more complicated than those in Spring MVC's, at least I've tested and the plugin test codes show that.

This is an interesting feature, I want to try.

Let me explain it more clearly.

When the user injects the alarm rule through gRPC, he can't confirm if
these rules are accepted by OAP. For other configuration storage,
we can accept those rules through its API. But for gRPC, they're saved in
memory, we no approach, for example, metrics or
logs, can help us touch them.

Now, what's this feature used for?

1. Help debug alarm issues.
2. For alarm e2e in the future.

OK, I just assign this to you. Several keys. 
1. A new receiver module is required.
1. Register for the endpoint(pagePath) is the first priority work.
1. The browser-related sources should be new and separated too all related sources. OAL and antlr should be changed too.
1. All sources should be designed and discussed first.

### Metrics are following
1. PV for every page(endpoint), version(instance) and service
1. The error rate for every page.
1. TopN page is automatically available by topN query, don't need to implement
1. Error logs for every `BrowserErrorLog`, with rate sampling.
1. Avg value of all fields in PerfDetail.

~~To @Fine0830, a question, what metrics are required for all fields in PerfDetail. Avg time? Maybe.~~

@hanahmily I know your issue, my point is your proposal is not right, as endpoint verification requires the check run on every OAP instance. But you even don't know that. How do you plan to fix this?

In my mind, the alarm rule with some ID when it requires for the next update. Then the alarm rule management system will know their new alarm rule effective or not.

> OK, I just assign this to you. Several keys.
> 
> 1. A new receiver module is required.
> 2. Register for the endpoint(pagePath) is the first priority work.
> 3. The browser-related sources should be new and separated too all related sources. OAL and antlr should be changed too.
> 4. All sources should be designed and discussed first.
> 
> ### Metrics are following
> 1. PV for every page(endpoint), version(instance) and service
> 2. The error rate for every page.
> 3. TopN page is automatically available by topN query, don't need to implement
> 4. Error logs for every `BrowserErrorLog`, with rate sampling.
> 
> To @Fine0830, a question, what metrics are required for all fields in PerfDetail. Avg time? Maybe.

Yes. The data is displayed according to the average value of the indicator data in the specified time period. The average value can reflect the average performance over a period of time, but it is easily affected by the extreme value. For example, a user visiting the network is very poor, resulting in the overall page load is very slow, and the average value of the data will be directly pulled up. So I think we can do a filter and use the filter of extremum to remove the extremum and avoid the influence of extremum on the overall trend of performance.
@Fine0830 Your description is the difference between avg and p50 :) That is also why other metrics have p99->p50 to exclude the extreme values.
You should run `./mvnw clean package` locally and passed first.
Your `ip:port` is being used. Nothing special.
Ooh.... I don't quite understand p99->p50. I think `PerfDetail` also need avg value and p99->p50, like other metrics. WDYT @wu-sheng
p50 means 50% of request duration is below the value, which wouldn't be affected by the long tail issue. Same for others. It is very easy to extend from avg to p99->50.
